title: Chelsea and Man United target Marco Verratti says he'd have "no problem joining" Juventus if he was to leave PSG
text:

Marco Verratti is on the radar of many Premier League sides as well as some other top clubs around Europe. 
Paris Saint-Germain have maintained that their star man will not be going anywhere, and the Italian has for the most part suggested he will stay in the French capital. 
Last week the Italian's agent claimed Verratti is keen to win silverware, and a move away from the club is possible in the near future. 
Asked at the time if the 24-year-old will still be at PSG next season, his agent told Gazzetta dello Sport: "The situation is very complicated. The PSG midfielder has said he is happy at the club (Photo: David Price) 
"He has a very good contract until 2021. He wants to win and PSG, like it is, cannot win. 
"He has been in Paris for five years now and he has to make a decision: earn a lot and not win or earn and become a champion. 
"It is not a problem of money. Whoever signs Verratti will pay him a lot of money. One thing is certain: if he leaves PSG, it will be for a top European club." Verratti's agent suggested a transfer away from Paris could be a possibility (Photo: EPA) 
The Italian midfielder has now given a hint as to his potential destination, should he indeed part company with Unai Emery at PSG. 
"Italy has a great league. Two teams like Inter and Milan, or Juventus, are capable of spending. We have seen that with Higuain," said Verratti, per Sport. Verratti said he would have "no problem joining" Juventus (Photo: Getty) 
"Juventus are one of the four best teams in the world. They have progressed a lot. 
"If in the future I leave PSG, I would not have any problem in going to this club, but today I am good where I am." poll loading Will Marco Verratti ever play for Juventus? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
